NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterType: %1.Prepare requires all parameters to have an explictly set type.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterSize: %1.Prepare requires all variable length parameters to have an explictly set non-zero Size.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterScale: %1.Prepare requires parameters of type '%2' have an explictly set Precision and Scale.

NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLNoTableInfo: Dynamic SQL generation is not supported against a SelectCommand that does not return any base table information.

NLS_STRINGS.DB2CommandBuilder_QuoteSuffix: The character used in a text command as the closing quote for quoting identifiers that contain special characters.

NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_SourceNotExist: The source column '%1' in the column mapping does not exist in the source.

NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Database: The name of the database to connect to.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_UserID: The value representing the user name
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Password: The value representing the user password
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ServerType: The type of server to which you want to connect (UniData, UniVerse)
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CodePage: The code page identifier of the encoding.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_WalletID: The ID of the encryption key wallet for U2 Data Server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_WalletPwd: The password for the encryption key wallet for U2 Data Server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Server: The server name with optional port number for direct connection. Syntax: server name[:port]
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MinPoolSize: The value representing the minimum number of connections to be held in the pool
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MaxPoolSize: The value representing the maximum number of connections in each pool
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectionRes: True - This particular connection will be put into the connection pool when it is closed. False - This particular connection will not be put into the connection pool when it is closed
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectionLif: The Amount of time (seconds) that the connection can remain idle in the connection pool. Default is 60 seconds.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Enlist: True - Enlistment to Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) is allowed (this will only enlist if a COM+ transaction is in progress at connect time) False - enlistment to Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) is not allowed
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_PersistSecuri: True - Allow security-sensitive information, such as password, to be returned as part of the connection string after the connection has been opened or if the connection has ever been in an opened state. False - Security-sensitive information is not returned as part of the connection string. False is strongly recommended.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectionTim: The value representing the number of seconds for a connection attempt to wait before it times out
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_QueryTimeout: The value representing the interval in seconds between query timeout checks
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_IsolationLeve: Isolation level for the connection; possible values are: ReadCommitted ReadUncommitted RepeatableRead Serializable This keyword is only supported for applications participating in a distributed transaction, such as a COM+ application. For applications that do not participate in a distributed transaction, this keyword is not supported and an InvalidArgument exception is thrown.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CurrentSchema: The value of the schema name used for all unqualified SQL objects used in the connection
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CLISchema: This keyword indicates that a set of db2ocat tables should be queried to generate the schema function result sets. The string value setting is the schema name of the db2ocat tables. For example, CLISCHEMA=CAT001 uses CAT001 as the schema of the db2ocat tables.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SysSchema: This keyword indicates that a set of shadow catalog tables should be used instead of the actual system catalog tables. The schemaName value is the schema for the shadow catalog tables.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_DBName: The value specifies the database name to reduce the time it takes for the application to query z/OS or OS/390 table information.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_TableType: The TABLETYPE keyword is used to restrict the result sets of the SQLTables stored procedure to a set of table types. Syntax: TABLETYPE="type1,type2,typeN"
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SchemaList: The SCHEMALIST keyword is used to restrict the result sets of the schema functions to a set of schemas. Syntax: SCHEMALIST ="schema1,schema2,schema3,..."
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapDate: The MAPDATE keyword indicates that DATE types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPDATE = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report DATE columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report DATE columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapTime: The MAPTIME keyword indicates that TIME types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPTIME = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report TIME columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report TIME columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapTimestamp: The MAPTIMESTAMP keyword indicates that TIMESTAMP types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPTIMESTAMP = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report TIMESTAMP columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report TIMESTAMP columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_NonSeqByteAccess: Invalid %3 attempt at dataIndex '%1'. With CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess, you may only read from dataIndex '%2' or greater.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_CommandTimeout: Time to wait for command to execute.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_Transaction: The transaction used by the command.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_UpdatedRowSource: When used by a DataAdapter.Update, how command results are applied to the current DataRow.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Command_DisableCursorHold: The value representing whether or not cursors should be left open after committing a transaction.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionString: Information used to connect to a Data Source.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionTimeout: Current connection timeout value, not settable in the ConnectionString.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_Database: Current data source catalog value, 'Database=X' in the connection string.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_DataSource: Current data source, 'Server=X' in the connection string.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ServerVersion: Version of the server accessed by the DB2 driver.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ServerType: Type of the server accessed by the DB2 driver.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientUser: The client user ID that is sent to a database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientWorkStation: The client workstation name sent to the database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientAccountingInformatio: The client accounting string that is sent to a database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientApplicationInformati: The client application name that is sent to a database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientProgramName: The default client application name to a user-defined name which is used to identify the application at the server when monitoring.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientProgramID: The user-defined character string that associates an application with a connection.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionBusyWithUpdateBa: %1: Connection is busy with an Update Batch
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ServerFunctionalLevel: Functional level of the server accessed by the DB2 driver.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_DeleteCommand: Used during Update for deleted rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_InsertCommand: Used during Update for new rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_UpdateCommand: Used during Update for modified rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_IsNullable: Property that indicates whether the parameter is nullable.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_SourceColumn: When used by a DataAdapter.Update, the source column name that is used to find the DataSetColumn name in the ColumnMappings. This is to copy a value between the parameter and a datarow.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_SourceVersion: When used by a DataAdapter.Update (UpdateCommand only), the version of the DataRow value that is used to update the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataParameter_Size: Size of variable length data types (string & arrays).
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_ArrayLength: Indicates the number of elements to consider from the given input array.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2DataAdapter_UpdateNotAllowedWhenChain: DataAdapter.Update not supported when Chaining is on
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_ObjectNotAccessibleFromCurrentRow: The object is not accessible from the current row.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_NoMoreData: There is no more data to return.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_CanNotMixStreaming: Can not mix streaming and non-streaming data access methods when data caching is disabled.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_captureMode: Specifies whether to capture information about SQL statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_executionMode: Specifies whether to run statically the SQL statements in the capture file that is specified by the pureQueryXml option.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_pureQueryXML: Specifies the fully-qualified, or relative path to, the file that is created by the process of capturing SQL statements or that is read from if the .NET application is run with executionMode set to STATIC.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_rootPkgName: Specifies the stem of the name to use for DB2 packages.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_traceFile: Enables tracing for pureQuery activities and specifies the physical file to write the log into.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_allowDynamicS: Specifies whether to allow an application to run the following types of SQL statements dynamically: SQL statements that are not captured in a pureQueryXML file, and SQL statements that are captured in a pureQueryXML file but which have not been bound by the StaticBinder utility.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_capturedOnly: Specifies whether to run only the SQL statements that are in the pureQueryXML file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_enableDynamic: Specifies whether to run alternative SQL statements in a pureQueryXML file, where neither those alternative statements nor the corresponding original statements were bound by the StaticBinder utility.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_maxNonParmSQL: Specifies the maximum number of non-parameterized SQL statements to capture. This option applies only when the value of captureMode is ON. When captureMode is OFF, pureQuery ignores this parameter.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_sqlLiteralSub: Specifies whether to perform literal substitution. When this option is enabled, pureQuery Runtime attempts to replace literal values in SQL statements with parameter markers and capture the parameterized versions of the statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_traceLevel: Specifies the level of detail to write to the log file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_propertiesGro: Specifies a runtime group ID in a repository that is created in a database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_pureQueryXmlR: Specifies the repository location of the PDQXML file to be used with a pureQuery enabled application.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_repositoryReq: Specifies the pureQuery client optimization behavior if errors occur during retrieving or writing pureQuery data.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_SystemNaming: Sets the system naming or the SQL naming mode when used against DB2 for i server which supports both modes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_BatchCommandTimeout: Gets or sets the command timeout for chaining.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_GetSchema_MissingDescribeI: GetSchema is unable to determine the complete describe information for the result set
NLS_STRINGS.Auth_rule_names_cant_contain_char: Authorization rule names cannot contain the '%1' character.
NLS_STRINGS.Connection_name_not_specified: The attribute 'connectionStringName' is missing or empty.
NLS_STRINGS.Connection_string_not_found: The connection name '%1' was not found in the applications configuration or the connection string is empty.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_AccountLockOut: The user account has been locked out.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_InvalidPassword: The password supplied is invalid. Passwords must conform to the password strength requirements configured for the default provider.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_InvalidProviderUserKey: The provider user key supplied is invalid. It must be of type System.Guid.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_InvalidQuestion: The password-question supplied is invalid. Note that the current provider configuration requires a valid password question and answer. As a result, a CreateUser overload that accepts question and answer parameters must also be used.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_more_than_one_user_with_email: More than one user has the specified e-mail address.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_password_too_long: The password is too long: it must not exceed 128 chars after encrypting.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_PasswordRetrieval_not_support: This Membership Provider has not been configured to support password retrieval.
NLS_STRINGS.Membership_PasswordReset_not_supported: This Membership Provider has not been configured to support password reset.
NLS_STRINGS.PageIndex_bad: The pageIndex must be greater than or equal to zero.
NLS_STRINGS.PageIndex_PageSize_bad: The combination of pageIndex and pageSize cannot exceed the maximum value of System.Int32.
NLS_STRINGS.PageSize_bad: The pageSize must be greater than zero.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_array_empty: The array parameter '%1' should not be empty.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_can_not_be_empty: The parameter '%1' must not be empty.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_can_not_contain_comma: The parameter '%1' must not contain commas.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_duplicate_array_element: The array '%1' should not contain duplicate values.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_too_long: The parameter '%1' is too long: it must not exceed %2 chars in length.
NLS_STRINGS.Password_does_not_match_regular_expressi: The parameter '%1' does not match the regular expression specified in config file.
NLS_STRINGS.Password_need_more_non_alpha_numeric_cha: Non alpha numeric characters in '%1' needs to be greater than or equal to '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.Password_too_short: The length of parameter '%1' needs to be greater or equal to '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProvider_ApplicationNameE: The ApplicationName cannot exceed character length %1.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProvider_BadConnection: The specified connectionStringName, '%1', was not registered.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProvider_CantAccess: A connection could not be made by the %1 personalization provider using the specified registration.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProvider_NoConnection: The connectionStringName attribute must be specified when registering a personalization provider.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProvider_UnknownProp: Invalid attribute '%1', specified in the '%2' personalization provider registration.
NLS_STRINGS.Property_Had_Malformed_Url: The '%1' property had a malformed URL: %2.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_application_name_too_long: The application name is too long.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_can_not_retrieve_hashed_passwor: Configured settings are invalid: Hashed passwords cannot be retrieved. Either set the password format to different type, or set supportsPasswordRetrieval to false.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_Error: The Provider encountered an unknown error.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_Schema_Version_Not_Match: The '%1' requires a database schema compatible with schema version '%2'. However, the current database schema is not compatible with this version. You may need to either install a compatible schema with aspnet_regsql.exe (available in the framework installation directory), or upgrade the provider to a newer version.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_this_user_already_in_role: The user '%1' is already in role '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_user_not_found: The user was not found in the database.
NLS_STRINGS.Role_is_not_empty: This role cannot be deleted because there are users present in it.
NLS_STRINGS.SiteMapProvider_cannot_remove_root_node: Root node cannot be removed from the providers, use RemoveProvider(string providerName) instead.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Error_Connection_String: An error occurred while attempting to initialize a IBM.Data.DB2.DB2Connection object. The value that was provided for the connection string may be wrong, or it may contain an invalid syntax.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Express_file_not_found_in_connection_: SQL Express filename was not found in the connection string.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2PersonalizationProvider_Description: Personalization provider that stores data in a IBM Data server database.
NLS_STRINGS.Value_must_be_boolean: The value must be boolean (true or false) for property '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.Value_must_be_non_negative_integer: The value must be a non-negative 32-bit integer for property '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.Value_must_be_positive_integer: The value must be a positive 32-bit integer for property '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.Value_too_big: The value '%1' can not be greater than '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_TrimmedEmp: Input parameter '%1' cannot be an empty string.
NLS_STRINGS.StringUtil_Trimmed_String_Exceed_Maximum: Trimmed string value '%1' of input parameter '%2' cannot exceed character length %3.
NLS_STRINGS.MinRequiredNonalphanumericChars_can_not_: The minRequiredNonalphanumericCharacters can not be greater than minRequiredPasswordLength.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_Empty_Coll: Input parameter '%1' cannot be an empty collection.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_Null_Or_Em: Input parameter '%1' cannot contain null or empty string entries.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_CannotHave: Input parameter '%1' cannot have comma in string value '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_Trimmed_En: Trimmed entry value '%1' of input parameter '%2' cannot exceed character length %3.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_More_Than_: Input parameter '%1' cannot contain more than one entry when '%2' contains some entries.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_Negative_I: The input parameter cannot be negative.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationAdmin_UnexpectedPersonali: The negative value '%1' is returned when calling provider's '%2' method. The method should return non-negative integer.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonaliizationProviderHelper_Null_Entr: Input parameter '%1' cannot contain null entries.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_Invalid_Le: Input parameter '%1' must be greater than or equal to %2.
NLS_STRINGS.PersonalizationProviderHelper_No_Usernam: Input parameter '%1' cannot be provided when '%2' is set to '%3'.
NLS_STRINGS.Provider_this_user_already_not_in_role: The user '%1' is already not in role '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.Not_configured_to_support_password_reset: This provider is not configured to allow password resets. To enable password reset, set enablePasswordReset to \"true\" in the configuration file.
NLS_STRINGS.Parameter_collection_empty: The collection parameter '%1' should not be empty.
NLS_STRINGS.DbFileName_can_not_contain_invalid_chars: The database filename can not contain the following 3 characters: [ (open square brace), ] (close square brace) and ' (single quote)
NLS_STRINGS.Error_parsing_sql_partition_resolver_str: Error parsing the SQL connection string returned by an instance of the IPartitionResolver type '%1': %2
NLS_STRINGS.No_database_allowed_in_sqlConnectionStri: The sqlConnectionString attribute or the connection string it refers to cannot contain the connection options 'Database', 'Initial Catalog' or 'AttachDbFileName'. In order to allow this, allowCustomDB2Database attribute must be set to true and the application needs to be granted unrestricted DB2ClientPermission. Please check with your administrator if the application does not have this permission.
NLS_STRINGS.No_database_allowed_in_sql_partition_res: The SQL connection string (server='%2', database='%3') returned by an instance of the IPartitionResolver type '%1' cannot contain the connection options 'Database', 'Initial Catalog' or 'AttachDbFileName'. In order to allow this, allowCustomDB2Database attribute must be set to true and the application needs to be granted unrestricted DB2ClientPermission. Please check with your administrator if the application does not have this permission.
NLS_STRINGS.Cant_connect_sql_session_database: Unable to connect to IBM Data Server session database.
NLS_STRINGS.Cant_connect_sql_session_database_partit: Unable to connect to IBM Data Server session database. The connection string (server='%2', database='%3') was returned by an instance of the IPartitionResolver type '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.Login_failed_sql_session_database: Failed to login to session state IBM Data server for user '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.Invalid_session_state: The session state information is invalid and might be corrupted.
NLS_STRINGS.Missing_required_attribute: The '%1' attribute must be specified on the '%2' tag.
NLS_STRINGS.Invalid_boolean_attribute: The '%1' attribute must be set to 'true' or 'false'.
NLS_STRINGS.Empty_attribute: The '%1' attribute cannot be an empty string.
NLS_STRINGS.Config_base_unrecognized_attribute: Unrecognized attribute '%1'. Note that attribute names are case-sensitive.
NLS_STRINGS.Unexpected_provider_attribute: The attribute '%1' is unexpected in the configuration of the '%2' provider.
NLS_STRINGS.Only_one_connection_string_allowed: DB2WebEventProvider: Specify either a connectionString or connectionStringName, not both.
NLS_STRINGS.Cannot_use_integrated_security: DB2WebEventProvider: connectionString can only contain connection strings that use DB2 Server authentication. Trusted Connection security is not supported.
NLS_STRINGS.Must_specify_connection_string_or_name: DB2WebEventProvider: Either a connectionString or connectionStringName must be specified.
NLS_STRINGS.Invalid_max_event_details_length: The value '%2' specified for the maxEventDetailsLength attribute of the '%1' provider is invalid. It should be between 0 and 1073741823.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_webevent_provider_events_dropped: %1 events were discarded since last notification was made at %2 because the event buffer capacity was exceeded.
NLS_STRINGS.Invalid_provider_positive_attributes: The attribute '%1' is invalid in the configuration of the '%2' provider. The attribute must be set to a non-negative integer.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Security: To enable SSL, set this value to SSL
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SSLClientKeys: Set SSLClientKeystoredb to the fully-qualified key database file name.
Set SSLClientKeystash to the fully-qualified stash file name.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SSLClientLabe: The value indicates a SSL label uniquely identifying a certificate within keystore database.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SSLClientKeys: The value indicates keystore database password.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_TrustedContex: The value representing the SYSTEM AUTHID of the trusted context
The value representing the password for the SYSTEM AUTHID of the trusted context
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConcurrentAcc: The value representing the mode which the database manager will use when accessing rows that are in the process of being inserted, updated or deleted
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_HostVarParame: The value representing whether or not host variable style parameters are processed in SQL statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_NamedParamete: The value representing whether or not named parameters are processed in SQL statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_EnsureDefault: The value representing whether or not to ensure DecimalFloatRoundingMode is set to HalfEven.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_DelimIdent: The value representing whether or not double-quoted strings are delimited database identifiers.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_UseIsnullSP: The value representing whether or not to use the IsNull stored procedure
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_DisableCursor: The value representing whether or not cursors should be left open after committing a transaction.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_RetrieveXmlIn: The value representing whether or not XML data should be returned in binary format.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_StatementConc: The value configuring StatementConcentrator setting on the server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SkipSynonymPr: The value representing whether the connection string must be processed to handle synonyms before adding it to a permission set.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ExtendedIndicatorsUnsuppor: Extended Indicators are not supported by this database server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_ExtendedIndicatorsNotEnable: Extended indicators support has not been enabled for this command.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_Default_Unassigned_Conflict: IsDefault and IsUnassigned can not both be enabled.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_DB2Explain: The value representing how the Explain information should be generated by the server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SessionTimeZo: The value used for setting the SESSION TIMEZONE special register on the zOS server.
NLS_STRINGS.ExtendedIndicators_WrongValue: Extended indicators cannot be explicitly disabled.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Command_ExtendedIndicators_Prepared: Extended Indicators cannot be enabled on a prepared command.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ExtendedIndicators_Prepare: One or more commands associated with this connection are in a prepared state.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_CursorOutparam_ExecNonQuery: A cursor can only be accessed from an output parameter if the query has been executed with ExecuteNonQuery
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_FitHighPrecis: The value indicating how high precision data types are handled when returning .NET system types
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_TargetPrincip: The value representing fully qualified Kerberos principal name for the target server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Command_ArrayBindCount: The value indicating the number of expected elements in the array to be bound for every parameter.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Command_AtomicArrayInput: The value indicating, when ArrayBindCount property is set, whether the underlying processing should be done as atomic or non-atomic.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_ArrayLength_Error: Array data type is not supported with DB2Command.ArrayBindCount setting.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Parameter_ArrayLength_ArrayBindCount_: DB2Parameter.ArraySize property must not be set when DB2Command.ArrayBindCount property is set.
NLS_STRINGS.BlockForNRows_WrongValue: The BlockForNRows must be greater than or equal to zero.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectNodeNu: The value indicates the database partition number to which connection is to be made.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CurrentPackag: The value indicates the collection identifier to be used to select the package to use for subsequent SQL statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CurrentSQLID: The value indicates the SQLID to be used for the connection.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_NewPWD: The value of the new password for the user.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_RetryParamete: The value indicating whether or not the provider will re-execute statements failed due to parameter type mismatch.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ClientCorrela: The value helps in correlating the processing between the application server and the application requester.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ClientCorrelationToken: The value helps in correlating the processing between the application server and the application requester.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CurrentFuncti: The property indicates the schemas that are used to resolve function references and data type references in dynamic SQL statements.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_EnableEFCaseS: Sets the Entity Data Model property to indicate whether the Entity Data Model objects are case-sensitive.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SSLServerCert: The value indicates the fully qualified file name of server's self-signed certificate or server's CA Certificate.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Db2dumpSQLCod: Specifies whether diagnostic logs are gathered when specified SQL Codes are encountered in a connection to the zOS server.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Db2DumpSQLCod: Specifies the time period in seconds during which the log information for the SQLCODE is not captured.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_TrustedContex: Sends the user registry name in the connection string while switching to a trusted connection
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_LibraryList: The list of Libraries to be loaded at the server. This value is space separated.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_FetchBufferSi: Specifies the default query block size to optimize the data flow.
